sn2.13:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn2.13:4.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful god Dīghalaṭṭhi, lighting up the entire Bamboo Grove, went up to the Buddha,
sn2.13:4.5: and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn2.13:5.1: “Suppose a mendicant is one who practices absorption, freed in mind.
sn2.13:5.2: If they want to reach the heart’s peace,
sn2.13:5.3: having known the arising and passing of the world,
sn2.13:5.4: healthy-minded, independent, that is their reward.”
